title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message: 820-3208 with corrosion only at u5010, r5000 and c5025. Changed them out, cleaned the area, turned on and display worked. Ran ASD with no issue. Suddenly the display stopped working. No more corrosion around the board, no BKLT voltage, no display... ideas?

title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message:
What voltage is PPVCORE_S0_CPU when you have no screen?

What voltage do you measure on pin 1 of U9000 when you have no screen?

How does pin 2 of R7402 look?

title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message: If it still turns on and chimes I think it will be SMC_LID, it should be high with the LCD open. Check IO board and cable for corrosion.

title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message:
@larossmann
U9000 p1=0
Ppvcore_S0_cpu=.87
R7402=Looks fine and measures 91k ohms

title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message:
@dukefawks

Smc_lid measures 3.3v out of the computer. R5071 measures 98ohms

title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message: Does a USB mouse light up when plugged in?

title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message: No, a wired mouse does not light up... damn and I remember [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] doing a video on this. Can't remember what a non working/USB suggests.

title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message: I suppose that suggests vcore, but there is voltage and everything looks fine around the buck converter.

title: 820-3208 intermittent display
message: So if the USB mouse does not light up and the is CPU Vcore then it can be anything. Throw it in the ultrasonic cleaner first, probably corrosion under SMC/PCH/CPU
